required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.official_title: Physical Activity and Testicular Cancer - a Pilot Study: Feasibility and Effects of a Program Including Information, Counseling and a Physical Activity Program for Patients With Testicular Cancer During and After Chemotherapy

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to determine the feasibility and effect of a program including information, counseling and an individualized physical activity program on physical and psychological health during and after chemotherapy in patients with testicular cancer. It is hypothesized that the patients are able to complete the intervention with individual adjustments.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline (0 weeks), post-intervention (9-12 weeks) and follow-up (24 weeks)
primary_outcome.description: Change in 1RM from baseline to post-intervention and follow-up

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline (0 week), post-intervention (9-12 weeks) and follow-up (24 weeks)
secondary_outcome.description: Change in VO2max from baseline to post-intervention and follow-up

secondary_outcome.measure: Body composition (Lean body mass and fat mass)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline (0 week), post-intervention (9-12 weeks) and follow-up (24 weeks)
secondary_outcome.description: Change in body composition from baseline to post-intervention and follow-up

secondary_outcome.measure: Metabolic disease markers (blood pressure, body mass index, glucose, high density lipoprotein cholesterol, triglycerides)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline (0 week), post-intervention (9-12 weeks) and follow-up (24 weeks)
secondary_outcome.description: Change in metabolic disease markers from baseline to post-intervention and follow-up

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline (0 week), post-intervention (9-12 weeks) and follow-up (24 weeks)
secondary_outcome.description: Change in CRP from baseline to post-intervention and follow-up

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline (0 week), post-intervention (9-12 weeks) and follow-up (24 weeks)
secondary_outcome.description: Change in CK from baseline to post-intervention and follow-up

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline (0 week), post-intervention (9-12 weeks) and follow-up (24 weeks)
secondary_outcome.description: Change in CK-MB from baseline to post-intervention and follow-up

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline (0 week), post-intervention (9-12 weeks) and follow-up (24 weeks)
secondary_outcome.description: Change in myoglobin from baseline to post-intervention and follow-up

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline (0 week), post-intervention (9-12 weeks) and follow-up (24 weeks)
secondary_outcome.description: Change in work status from baseline to post-intervention and follow-up

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline (0 week), post-intervention (9-12 weeks) and follow-up (24 weeks)
secondary_outcome.description: Change in fatigue from baseline to post-intervention and follow-up

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline (0 week), post-intervention (9-12 weeks) and follow-up (24 weeks)
secondary_outcome.description: Change in anxiety and depression from baseline to post-intervention and follow-up

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline (0 week), post-intervention (9-12 weeks) and follow-up (24 weeks)
secondary_outcome.description: Change in quality of life from baseline to post-intervention and follow-up

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Seminoma/non-seminoma
- Stage II-IV
- 3-4 BEP(bleomycin,etoposide and cisplatin)or 4 EP(etoposide and cisplatin)
- > 18 years
- Capable of reading and writing Norwegian
Exclusion Criteria:
- Conditions of a severity that contraindicate exercise without adjusted actions
- Mentally incompetent conditions
- Conditions of a severity that complicates the ability to participate in a supervised training program
